ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved upon my ability to speak, understand, read and write Portuguese.
I feel that my portuguese skills really improved and I learned a lot about topics that I was not familiar with to begin with.
Notably improved development of linguistic ability, listening comprehension, and writing skills in Portuguese. I also furthered my understanding of and contact with Lusophone culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I like the seminar style of the course, this encourages me to participate more and practice speaking. 

Weaknesses: The lectures always ran late. It sometimes felt like the projects and assignments contributed nothing to my learning. Also the course is Portuguese but we only learn about Brazil and Brazilian Portuguese. I would like to learn more about the language and culture from Portugal. However, this is something that none of the Portuguese courses here seem to offer.
Strength was definitely the professor who really cares about her students

Strengths: Giseli is a fantastic professor. She is supportive and engages with each of her students to form a connection and foster their linguistic development. She is genuinely caring and seems very invested in the success of her students to acquire Portuguese.
Weakness: This course advanced a very selective interpretation of the world. For a course that I enrolled in with the intention to learn a new language, I would have appreciated less instruction of one sided political ideology and instead had that time for more instruction of components that foster overall language acquisition skills. The emphasis on politics seemed misplaced and many students were not yet equipped with the linguistic ability to positively or negatively discuss the complexities of preferred world structure in a foreign language they are acquiring and instead complied with the given views. This aspect diminished my enthusiasm for the course and missed an opportunity to further engage me in Lusophone culture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would if they cared more about learning the language to use it casually because we do not learn much about the finer details required for writing. I would not recommend the course to anyone interested in learning more about the language and the culture of Portugal.
I would. There is a lot of homework and a lot of time you have to dedicate to this course but overall it is worth it.
Yes, it was a great course. The lectures were routinely very fun and dynamic.
